availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Gustavus Artsman (Newport, Kentucky, attorney, and circuit court clerk)

body.p: Newport, Kentucky, attorney, and circuit clerk. Native of Saxony. Married to Sarah "Sallie" Artsman. Father of Jeanne Artsman, Augusta Artsman, Josie Artsman, Sussie Artsman, and Sallie Artsman. Clerk of the Campbell Circuit Court in Campbell County from 1858 to 1863. Attorney in Newport in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 182. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 2. Passport Applications, 1795-1905, Roll 229, May 23, 1879, no. 12656, National Archives and Records Administration, Washington, D.C. Thomas S. Page, “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1859,” in 1862 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 290. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861,” in 1862 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 303-308.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 298-306.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 301-306. Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7007125, Newport Deaths, p. unknown.
